ygData.subject: Re: The monster in Relay (attn Razorwing
ygData.msgSnippet: Following an alleyway, he reached the crossing of a major roadway, Not seeing any cars, he sneaked accross the road only to find the alleyways on that side

Following an alleyway, he reached the crossing of a major roadway,
Not seeing any cars, he sneaked accross the road only to find the
alleyways on that side were walled off.

The autobot stepped back and transformed into flight mode.  He then
flew over the wall and past a few buildings.  Not wanting to draw too
much attention, he flew up on top of a taller building, then
transformed back into robot mode.

He was surprised that he hadnt been bothered yet.  Why did this city
seem so empty?  Perhaps they were all hiding?

From his perch, he began to scan the surrounding area for signals.

On 1/19/08, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:
> The Autobot hovered over the edge of Relay City and transformed into
> robot mode.  Like a trained soldier, he imediately moved to cover and
> sneaked through the nearest gate into the city.
>
> Trying not to be seen, he immediately found a secluded space to walk;
> where he could move without being seen.
>
> OOC: I'm hoping he can either encounter residents or other maximals,
> but I guess anyone would be fine.
>
> On 1/10/08, Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:
> > Hatred.
> >
> > Over time, I found out that, on top of being a deep feeling, it is
> > also a terribly useful tool. Sharing that hatred makes people see
> > things you own way, and such an agreement is the beginning of an alliance.
> >
> > ********************************
> >
> > Magnum had been in relay for some time now. Despite his massive
> > appearance, he managed to stay hidden most of the time. He was vaguely
> > known, asa rumor in the hoodlums of the city.
> >
> > Little by little, he approached Silver Wings throughout the city. He
> > spoke with them, listened to them. They had been ravaged by the
> > uprising the Iron Skulls had lead and viewed Jotunn's demotion as a
> > candy punishment. The perpetrators, the soldiers themselves, had
> > barely been chastised for that, and resentment was strong because of
> > this inaction among the surviving population.
> >
> > He agreed with them, and told them they should get even in one way or
> > another. Like a prophet, people took him to heart and remembered him.
> > He was hope for the wounded, the hope of recovery and vengeance. He
> > only asked them not to speak directly of him. His influence grew by
> > the cycle.
> >
> > *********************************
> >
> > Intelligence reports had been scarce inside the city. Deadfur didn't
> > like that. They'd lost contacts there, and he'd decided to stay to
> > help rebuilding
> >
> > When an agent told him someone looking like the missing Sergeant Ultra
> > Magnus was talking of getting back at the Iron Skulls in the people's
> > area, that worried him. But, he didn't want to take decisions on that
> > himself. He went to Razorwing and handed him the datapad that
> > contained the report.
> >
> > Deafur: What d'you make of that? Should we worry?
> >
> >
>
